channel.title: Comments on: Macarons – Daring Bakers Challenge October 2009

item.title: By: laire @ therawnoodle
item.dc:creator: laire @ therawnoodle
item.description:
I have tried 2 different recipes and they both failed! The first time made it with the french meringue, second italian.
In both batches I used baking paper and no baking paper. The ones on baking paper looked horrible after baked. THe ones directly on the tray looked good, but there was a gap between the skin and feet! :( Both mixtures with and without paper were very difficult to remove!
I will attempt to make them again! Helen's recipe looks beautiful!~ I'm excited for you to have made so much progress! :)
item.content:encoded:
I have tried 2 different recipes and they both failed! The first time made it with the french meringue, second italian.

In both batches I used baking paper and no baking paper. The ones on baking paper looked horrible after baked. THe ones directly on the tray looked good, but there was a gap between the skin and feet! üôÅ Both mixtures with and without paper were very difficult to remove!

I will attempt to make them again! Helen’s recipe looks beautiful!~
I’m excited for you to have made so much progress! üôÇ

item.title: By: Lisa
item.dc:creator: Lisa
item.description: It was such fun following you on your journey from feetless macs to gorgeous, well 'heeled' textbook perfect macs. Love your flavors too, especially the raspberry white chocolate, and the salted caramel. that first photo is mouth watering!
item.content:encoded: It was such fun following you on your journey from feetless macs to gorgeous, well ‘heeled’ textbook perfect macs. Love your flavors too, especially the raspberry white chocolate, and the salted caramel. that first photo is mouth watering!

item.title: By: Barbara Bakes
item.dc:creator: Barbara Bakes
item.description: I'm so impressed with your progression and beautiful macs!
item.content:encoded: I’m so impressed with your progression and beautiful macs!

item.title: By: Allison
item.dc:creator: Allison
item.description: Congrats with sticking with it! I'm sad to say that I gave up after two attempts. The recipe from Tartlette does look like it yielded the best result. I will have to make that recipe my next attempt.
item.content:encoded: Congrats with sticking with it! I’m sad to say that I gave up after two attempts. The recipe from Tartlette does look like it yielded the best result. I will have to make that recipe my next attempt.

item.description: Great effort your macs look yumm to me and the ones you made using Helen‚Äôs recipe look perfect.
item.content:encoded: Great effort your macs look yumm to me and the ones you made using Helen‚Äôs recipe look perfect.

item.title: By: billy@ATFT
item.dc:creator: billy@ATFT
item.description: btw, holes means more fillings, even better! LOL! usually even with flat bottom, it is advised to squashed it in so it fit more fillings. is quite common, good job! :)
item.content:encoded: btw, holes means more fillings, even better! LOL! usually even with flat bottom, it is advised to squashed it in so it fit more fillings. is quite common, good job! üôÇ

item.description: Outstanding! Great job on the numerous attempts! Your final results look fantastic!
item.content:encoded: Outstanding! Great job on the numerous attempts! Your final results look fantastic!

item.title: By: Rosa

item.description:
Wow, you are daring and perseverant! Your macarons are fabulous! Wonderful flavors too!
Cheers,
Rosa
